dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A significant cold snap is hitting both Astana and Almaty starting this Thursday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A significant cold snap is hitting both Astana and Almaty starting this Thursday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 25, partly cloudy skies, intermittent rain, thunderstorms, and daytime hail are expected. Nighttime temperatures will be +13¦+15ÂC, and daytime +25¦+27ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just a little dip—we're talking temperatures dropping to as low as +4 degrees at night in Astana by Saturday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just a little dip-we're talking temperatures dropping to as low as +four degrees at night in Astana by Saturday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 25, partly cloudy weather with brief showers will persist. Temperatures will drop to +4¦+6ÂC at night and reach only +11¦+13ÂC during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the meteorologists are warning about possible hail and squally winds too, especially on May 23rd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the meteorologists are warning about possible hail and squally winds too, especially on May twenty third.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 23, the capital will see partly cloudy skies with occasional rain and thunderstorms. Hail and squally winds are possible during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, gusts up to 23 meters per second in some areas? That's intense, even for spring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, gusts up to twenty three meters per second in some areas? That's intense, even for spring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Northwesterly wind at 9"14 m/s, gusts reaching 15"20 m/s, and up to 23 m/s in some areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's interesting because, uh, Kazhydromet had actually predicted a warmer-than-usual May overall for the country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's interesting because, uh, Kazhydromet had actually predicted a warmer-than-usual May overall for the country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazhydromet previously reported that May temperatures are expected to be about 1ÂC above average across most of the country, making this spring significantly warmer than usual.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, about one degree above average, they said. So this sudden drop is pretty unexpected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, about one degree above average, they said. So this sudden drop is pretty unexpected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazhydromet previously reported that May temperatures are expected to be about 1ÂC above average across most of the country, making this spring significantly warmer than usual.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And in Almaty, they're still looking at warmer daytime temps, like mid-20s, but with all that thunderstorm activity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And in Almaty, they're still looking at warmer daytime temps, like mid-20s, but with all that thunderstorm activity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 24, partly cloudy skies will continue, with rain, thunderstorms, and possible hail. Nighttime temperatures will be +14¦+16ÂC, daytime +23¦+25ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so even though it's warmer there, you've still got hail and heavy rain in the forecast—not exactly picnic weather.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so even though it's warmer there, you've still got hail and heavy rain in the forecast-not exactly picnic weather.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rain is expected in the afternoon, sometimes heavy, along with thunderstorms and possible hail. Southwesterly wind at 3"8 m/s, with gusts up to 18 m/s during thunderstorms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the wind shift from northwest to northeast in Astana is gonna make it feel even colder.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the wind shift from northwest to northeast in Astana is gonna make it feel even colder.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 24, the weather will remain partly cloudy with intermittent rain. Winds will shift from northwest to northeast at 9"14 m/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: People are definitely gonna need to layer up and, um, maybe rethink any outdoor plans for the weekend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People are definitely gonna need to layer up and, um, maybe rethink any outdoor plans for the weekend.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially with the potential for ground frost on Saturday night—that's unusually cold for late May.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially with the potential for ground frost on Saturday night-that's unusually cold for late May.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It will be colder than usual, with the potential for ground frost. Plan your weekend accordingly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And don't forget the umbrella advice—both cities are gonna see intermittent rain all three days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And don't forget the umbrella advice-both cities are gonna see intermittent rain all three days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 24, the weather will remain partly cloudy with intermittent rain. Unstable weather is expected " don't forget your umbrella.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So if you're in Astana, pack a jacket; if you're in Almaty, maybe a raincoat and sunglasses? It's all over the place.

dialogue_turns.text: Hah, true. Unstable weather patterns for sure. Stay prepared, folks.
